decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of this decision.

Reason: In order to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications:  001 Received:  31 October 2024,  004 (Rev A) Received:  29 July 2024.  

Reason: In order to ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission.

Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building, unless otherwise shown on the approved plans.  

Reason: In order to safeguard the appearance of the area.

Condition : 4 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no additional windows, doors or other glazed openings shall be formed in the single storey rear infill and rear extension hereby permitted.  

Reasons:  To protect the appearance of the area and neighbour living conditions in accordance with Local Plan Policies SC7 (Residential extensions and alterations), CC1 (Context and character) and CC2 (Urban design and architecture) and the Residential Extension Guidelines.

Condition : 5 - Notwithstanding the submitted Proposed Ground Floor and Roof Plans, Proposed Section A-A and Rear and Side Elevations (Drawing Number 004 (Rev A), the single additional ground floor side window to the building's southern ground floor side elevation hereby permitted shall be obscure glazed and non-openable (excluding trickle vents within the window's frame) below 1.7 metres above finished floor level only and be permanently retained as such.  

Reasons:  To protect neighbour privacy and prevent overlooking in accordance with Local Plan Policies SC7 (Residential extensions and alterations) and CC2 (Urban design and architecture).
description: Variation of Condition 2 (Implementation - Approved Plans) to install one ground floor side window to the ground floor flat of Planning Permission P/2023/3211 approved 22/12/2023 for the 'Erection of a single storey rear extension'.
